title: Why does lameloshoes.com load faster and display better in Firefox?
content:
Hi Mozilla Support Team,

I've noticed that my website lameloshoes.com, which focuses on LaMelo Ball shoes and related fashion content, loads faster and displays more consistently in Firefox compared to some other browsers. Is there something Firefox is doing differently with caching, image rendering, or JavaScript handling that gives this performance boost?

Also, are there any official resources or optimization guides from Mozilla that we can follow to keep sites like ours fully compatible and high-performing on Firefox?

Thanks in advance!
creator: merijaneshoes

title: Request to Consider Adding Link to Merijanesole.com as a Helpful Resource
content:
Hello Mozilla Support Team,

I run a helpful, user-friendly site called merijanesole.com, which offers valuable content and guides related to fashion, particularly Mary Jane shoes. I'm reaching out to kindly ask if it’s possible for the Mozilla support or community pages to consider adding a link to my site where relevant — for example, in discussions or pages related to online shopping safety, fashion extensions, or resource recommendations.

The site is secure, content-rich, and designed to benefit users with honest reviews and styling tips. I’d really appreciate any guidance or support in making this request possible.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
creator: merijaneshoes

title: Can't setup Two-step authentication on my account, getting stuck on confirming backup code
content:
Hi!

I'm unable to setup my Two-step authentication on my account. Everytime i do it i do the following steps:

Click to add Two-step authentication Scan the QR code with Ente Enter the code that is generated Download and copy the backup code Enter the copy code

Then i get the following message: "There was a problem enabling two-step authentication. Check that your device’s clock is set to update automatically and start over."

Must have done this like 5 times now and it's always the same. I have checked that the clock it set to automatic. I have tried 3 different computers and 1 phone, it's always the same.

What can i do about this?

title: Firefox no longer opens on startup
content: For years I have had my Firefox set to open on startup. I log in to Windows 11 and my Firefox is already open. About a week ago that stopped happening. Nothing has changed on my system except maybe some automatic Windows updates. I still have the box checked in Firefox settings to open automatically on startup. It still no longer does that. I've tried to uncheck the box, restart Windows, recheck the box, restart Windows, but that isn't the fix. I saved my profile in Moz Backup, uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox, and that didn't work. Is it possible that a Firefox update might be responsible for this? If not, is there anything else I can try? It's not a big deal to have to click on an icon to start Firefox. I just got used to the convenience of automatic startup. Thanks.

title: Problem when restoring Firefox profile on Linux
content:
I used Firefox for many years, and I mainly used it on Linux. Since I am testing different distros from time to time, so I will reinstall FF often. Since I've an user a/c on FF, so that I can simply logon to restore my settings and that worked fine except few things.

1. I can not keep my theme settings and menu settings, such as using a dark theme and always show menu and bookmarks, I need to set the above every time I reinstall FF even with an a/c.

2. I got the error "Failed to read the configuration file. Please contact your system administrator" when I run FF on Raspberry Pi with Armbian desktop, despite of the error FF started normally. When I check the ".mozilla" folder, I found multiple profiles beside the default one I used, when I delete the extra ones and edit the "profile.ini" to remove them, I still found those profiles on the folder. Since I've some extensions installed as well as some screen settings, so I don't want to restart as new to re-do everything, is that any way to clean up my profiles while keeping my settings ?

3. I set couple websites to auto load when FF starts, I pin them to the tab to save some screen space, but I got double entries every time, the pinned ones and the one I set auto load on start, it seems no way to only auto start as pinned.

Thanks !
creator: bilmenot

title: Things rarely make any sense any more.
content:
I am a complete Luddite and with each passing day, the tech I used to be able to cope with, is changing so quickly I don't see how anyone can keep up. I can barely surf the internet anymore because I don't understand what half of the permissions questions are asking me. I also find that the word choices of those working in IT aren't the best at communicating clearly. Past examples: items will "populate". I thought populating was about people and populations. Don't lists and other things get compiled? Bad choice #2, I am frequently asked to click on "OK" as I interact with desktop O/S or websites in the midst of situations giving me grief. I would gladly click on "Acknowledge" but these are situations that are most definitely not OK.

I currently have Firefox installed on my Windows 10 desktop PC and a screen appeared suggesting I download Firefox. But why has this appeared? Do the processes going on in the background not understand I'm already using Firefox? From trying to follow directions where I am told what to expect I'll see on a screen and the steps for navigating that to accomplish something, but then not actually seeing what I was lead to believe I would, to my query here and now, less and less of things make sense any more, and it's really wearing me down. Thanks in advance to anyone paying attention.
creator: thatguythere

title: Compatibility
content:
I'm now finding multiple sites, notably my financial institution, which are giving me grief with the "cookie" question. I don't mind selecting my cookie preferences when I log on to a site....ONCE. But I am getting the cookie question with each page I go to on the site. I've called my bank and they tell me they are getting the same complaint from other customers and it's because I'm using Firefox. They are not seeing this problem with other supported browsers and of course their solution is to switch to Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome, which is NOT a solution and which I will never do,

Is anyone else here having this problem? If so, is their a solution?

Thank you
creator: jdemarco1

title: Is there a way to increase performance on YouTube?
content: It's mostly in the title. Ever since I switched to Firefox I noticed that while the videos play just fine, if I scroll down to the comments or to search for another video on the sidebar Firefox suddenly becomes extremely laggy and takes a good few minutes to actually load anything. Is there any way to fix this? (My Firefox is up to date and the only extensions I'm running are uBlock and Tampermonkey, but there aren't any scripts running through it specifically for YouTube)
